description: Define which teams or individuals can access a provider.

ID.description: ID is the identifier of the object.
ID.title: ID

accessDeniedMessage.description: The message that is sent if the access is denied.
accessDeniedMessage.title: accessDeniedMessage

action.description: Define if the provider is allowed or denied for the match expression.
action.title: action

alertDefinition.description: The definition to use for alerting when action is deny.
alertDefinition.title: alertDefinition

contentPolicies.description: The list of content policies to apply when the user has access to the provider.
contentPolicies.title: contentPolicies

disabled.description: If true, the policy is disabled.
disabled.title: disabled

importHash.description: The hash of the structure used to compare with new import version.
importHash.title: importHash

importLabel.description: The user-defined import label that allows the system to group resources from the same import operation.
importLabel.title: importLabel

match.description: The match criteria used to take a decision on the access.
match.title: match

minimalLogging.description: If true, the system will not log the messages that are not considered as violations.
minimalLogging.title: minimalLogging

name.description: The name of the access policy.
name.title: name

offbandAnalysis.description: If true, the system will run analysis in parallel of the user request. When this is active, no further policing will be done, and no content policy will run. This can be used to observe the transmitted data and have analysis report, without adding latency to the end user request, at the price of not being able to do any form of content moderation.
offbandAnalysis.title: offbandAnalysis

permissive.description: If set, just log the decision, but don't enforce it.
permissive.title: permissive

updateTime.description: Last update date of the object.
updateTime.title: updateTime

title: AccessPolicy
